text: I was horribly ill with mumps as a child. Even if there are no long-term repercussions, it's no joke.
author: vpostrel

text: A lot of what I see isn’t from people I follow but from people responding to or conversing with people I follow.
author: vpostrel

text: Yes, Twitter used to be a great way to find new sources of information and interesting conversations. But those voices are increasingly absent or drowned out.
author: vpostrel

text: Sorry I missed it. I wasn’t expecting  a generic press release about the museum from an outside firm. I deleted it assuming it was part of a mass mailing, since I already had the info from Indian press accounts.
author: vpostrel

text: On those rare occasions when I visit Twitter these days, I’m reminded what a distorted, emotional, angry world it is. It’s making the people on it crazy, and since many of them are journalists, that’s dangerous beyond Twitter. Get out, people!
author: vpostrel

text: Thanks. Very eager to hear back from you vp@vpostrel.com.

text: How does Trump compare to past presidents in cold, hard data? We looked at everything from polls and deficit figures to wages and the markets https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2019-opinion-trump-two-years/ … via @bopinion

text: In 2017 @bopinion columnists, including me, were asked to give metrics to measure the new president's performance. Every January, we do an update. Here it is: https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2019-opinion-trump-two-years/ …
